p.s: I was recently given an article by my friend Bianca about her experience working with children in a slum in Delhi.
She is 18 years old, from Germany who worked in an Education Center for children in India.
Bianca expresses that even though the long days with the kids may have been tiring and frustrating, she still loved every day she could spend with the kids.
Patience and thankfulness are only two among other things that the children taught her.
She tells us that she always wondered how the kids could be so happy and full of life despite their living condition.
Bianca describes them as loving, accepting and nosy about your background and life.
Therefore after spending at least two and a hald hours with the children a day, they grew on her.
All in all it was a great and fascinating experience for Bianca.
